channel.title: Posts on Tyler's Enormous Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Tyler's Enormous Blog

item.title: Custom Stack Implementataion
item.description: Introduction What is a Stack? FIFO LIFO Bags Implementations Array-Based FIFO Stack Introduction I’ve been trying to go through some DSA (Data Structures & Algorithms) stuff that I’ve forgotten in my time as a digital plummer at my last job. It’s humbling, to say the least. I suck at it. In my somewhat limited experience, most of Software Engineering is stitching together disparate systems and turning out product features as fast as humanly possible.

item.title: Re-taking the CompTIA Security+ Exam
item.description: Overview This is going to be a long one. I forgot to renew my CompTIA Security+ certification, so I’m re-taking it. What a treat. I’m using CompTIA Security+ Get Certified Get Ahead: SY0-501 Study Guide by Darril Gibson because the kindle edition was cheap and recommended. Let’s see how it goes! Note that I’m just jotting stuff down for my own benefit, I’m not promising any kind of coherence heh.

item.title: Reducing in Java
item.description: This is a thing that I have to look up and relearn every time I want to do it in Java, so here we go. What is a reduce operation? Reduce is a way to produce a single result when iterating over a sequence. This is technique that comes from functional programming. There are a lot of opinions out there concerning the relative merit of functional vs OOP vs imperative, but this is little article is not one of them.

item.title: On Layoffs
item.description: Believe it or not, I wasn’t always a tech guy. In my early 20’s, I was obsessed with music, to the point of obtaining a Bachelor’s of Music with a concentration in Sound Recording. I wanted desperately to be a cool studio musician/engineer like Steve Albini or Nigel Godrich. This period was roughly in the years 2008-2013; in my youthful naivet√©, I was unconcerned with the recession that had rocked my country.
